title: How to Connect a GoPro to a Computer

steps.title: Power on your GoPro.
steps.content: Power on your GoPro. Do so by pressing the Power/Mode button on the face or top of the camera until a red LED indicator comes on. If you're using a HERO3+ or older, turn Wi-Fi OFF on the camera before connecting it to your computer. There's a dedicated button to enable and disable Wi-Fi on the side of the camera. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the USB port.
steps.content: Locate the USB port. On many models, the port is a mini USB port on one of the sides of the GoPro.

steps.title: Connect the GoPro to your computer.
steps.content: Connect the GoPro to your computer. Use the cable that came with your GoPro. Attach the end with the USB mini-jack to your camera, and plug the USB jack into a vacant port on your computer. When the GoPro recognizes the USB connection to your computer, it should go into USB mode, causing a USB symbol to appear on the camera's screen if your camera is equipped with one. [2] X Research source Connect the camera to one of the main USB ports on your computer rather than a USB hub or a port on your keyboard or monitor. On a Mac, a camera icon will appear on the desktop. Double-click on it to access the photos and videos stored on the camera's microSD card. In Windows, go to My Computer , then locate your GoPro in the list of available drives and double-click on it. For HERO7 and earlier GoPros, Quik for desktop (Mac and Windows) will open.

steps.title: Remove the microSD card from your GoPro.
steps.content: Remove the microSD card from your GoPro. Not every camera comes with an extra storage card, so if you aren't sure if you have one, use the method for connecting a USB cable. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Insert the microSD card into an adapter or a card reader that's attached to your computer.
steps.content: Insert the microSD card into an adapter or a card reader that's attached to your computer. To do this step, you need either an adapter that allows your standard-sized SD card reader slot to accommodate the micro-sized chip from the GoPro or an external card reader that connects to your computer via USB, both of which you can find for purchase at almost any electronic retailer (like Best Buy). [4] X Research source If you have an adapter that you've put your microSD card into, you'll then need to insert it into the SD reader slot on your computer.

steps.title: Find your GoPro's files.
steps.content: Find your GoPro's files. Once your computer reads the card, your file manager will open (Finder for Mac and File Explorer for Windows), and you'll find your GoPro's SD card there (the name of the SD card will vary based on who manufactured it). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure you have the correct USB setting (HERO9 Black and HERO8 Black only).
steps.content: Make sure you have the correct USB setting (HERO9 Black and HERO8 Black only). Go to Preferences > Connections > USB Connections and select MTP if you want to use USB for file transfers. [6] X Research source To use the camera as a webcam, select GoPro Connect instead.

steps.title: Turn the GoPro off and back on once it's connected.
steps.content: Turn the GoPro off and back on once it's connected. The GoPro usually needs to be on when you make the connection, but if that doesn't work, you can try restarting it once you have the camera connected to your computer.

steps.title: Check all connections.
steps.content: Check all connections. You might have a loose connection between the camera and your computer.

steps.title: Replace the USB cable.
steps.content: Replace the USB cable. If the USB cable you have is completely plugged in without loose connections, you'll want to see if the cable is the issue by replacing it with another one. If the second cable works, you know that the first one is faulty. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Try another USB port.
steps.content: Try another USB port. The port on your computer may not be working, so try another port. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Restart your computer and camera.
steps.content: Restart your computer and camera. If none of the previous steps help, you can try restarting everything. Unplug the camera, then restart your computer, and finally reconnect the GoPro. Quik does not support HERO7, HERO8, or HERO 9. Instead, your computer's default photo app will open if your computer reads an "MTP" connection between your GoPro and your computer, then it's working as intended. With your camera unplugged from your computer, you can check this setting in your camera by going to Connections > USB Connection > MTP , which allows file transfers.
